result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Fitzgerald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Same as Complaint.

9:57 AM 15CF977, 15CM1019, 15CM1125 & 15CM1445 Defendant Michael J. Fitzgerald appeared by phone, in custody from the Western Reception Diagnostic & Correctional Center.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Michael J. Fitzgerald.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Defendant waives his right to appear in person. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 15CF977. and Court accepts waiver. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea in 15CF977: Count 1: Possession of Methamphetamine, Count 2 Disorderly Conduct and Count 3 Obstructing an Officer. Defendant enters a guilty plea in 2015CM1019: Count 1 Misd Battery as a Domestic and in 15CM1445: Count 1 Misd Bail Jumping. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders:
15CF977
Count 1: 6 months jail, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs, $1,675 in Extradition costs, and 3 bench warrant fees
Count 2: 90 days jail, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs,
Count 3: 6 months jail, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs,

15CM1019
Count 1: 6 months jail, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs,

15CM1445
Count 1: 6 months jail, DNA sample and surcharge, court costs,

Huber granted. All jail is concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence. 
239 days of jail credit in each case. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in, including all of 15CM1125
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights
Plea hearing on April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
